alert.note: Alert for Bailey; Castro; Parmer (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 28 at 2:03PM CDT until April 28 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...FROST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 AM TO 8 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Advisory, north winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. For the Frost Advisory, temperatures as low as 32 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Bailey, Castro, and Parmer Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Advisory, until 7 PM CDT this evening. For the Frost Advisory, from 2 AM to 8 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Strong winds will blow around unsecured objects and a few power outages may result. Blowing dust will cause reduced visibility at times. Frost could harm sensitive outdoor vegetation. Sensitive outdoor plants may be killed if left uncovered.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for compact and high profile vehicles on east-to-west roads. Use extra caution. Secure loose outdoor objects. Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold.
